item.title: Prediction of potential drug (Pharmocogenomics)
item.description: 5.1.1 Clue 5.1.2 CREEDS 5.1.3 L1000CDS² 5.1.4 PharmacoGx 5.1.5 DrugComboRanker 5.1.6 SEP-L1000 5.1.7 L1000FWD 5.1.8 Mantra 5.1.9 DvD 5.1.10 DSEA 5.1.11 cogena 5.1.12 gene2drug 5.1.13 DeSigN 5.1.14 ksRepo 5.1.15 iLINCS 5.1.16 Gene Expression Signature 5.1.17 PDOD 5.1.18 SigCom LINCS 5.1.19 DTX 5.1.20 Phosprof Drug repurposing (alternatively called “new uses for old drugs”) is a strategy for identifying new uses for approved or investigational drugs that are outside the scope of the original medical indication.
